position: Campus Undergraduate - 2021 American Express National Bank Summer Internship
description:
American Express National Bank (“AENB”) is American Express’ chartered national bank. Headquartered in Utah, AENB is the single largest entity within American Express’ business, currently representing more than 50 percent of the company’s Card Member Spending, nearly 90 percent of its lending and more than 60 percent its of revenues. AENB provides its customers with access to consistent payments, financing and savings products in three ways, including:

  • Issuing and servicing charge and credit cards for our consumer and small business segments; 
  • Offering commercial loans to small and midsized merchants, as well as installment loans to consumers; and
  • Maintaining a Personal Savings program consisting of high-yield savings accounts and certificate of deposit products.

AENB is also home to The Center for Community Development (“CCD”) for American Express. The CCD is charged with the implementation and execution of the Community Reinvestment Act (“CRA”), which requires banks, like AENB, to meet community credit needs, particularly those of low- and moderate-income individuals and communities.

We are passionate about our commitment to drive AENB’s goals of growth and progress by creating a culture of awareness and proactivity around regulatory matters, and by partnering closely with affiliates across the enterprise to ensure we deliver maximum value to our shareholders and our customers efficiently and effectively. AENB is dedicated to building diversity and inclusive leadership across all levels of the organization.

Within AENB the Vendor and Operational Risk team is responsible for managing AENB’s affiliate and third party vendor risk programs, leading the company’s intercompany agreement center of excellence, and executing the AENB’s operational risk framework within the 1st line of defense.
